intro: Tithymalus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodland or scrub habitats. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The leaves are elongated and often have a mild, spicy scent, which can be used in traditional herbal remedies.
